page.title: 15TWINNING/BEST KEPT VILLAGE
page.content: Horstead Keynes twinned with its name sake Cahagnes in Normandy. As a result Slaugham Parish (near Horsted Keynes) and S.Martin de Besaces ,near Cahagnes decided to be twinned.Two secretaries, one from each of the villages arrange exchange visits each year. About 35 people from each parish take part. The people from Slaugham go by coach and ferry (via Portsmouth) to S. Martin. They stay with French families and enjoy the differences in life style meeting and talking with French People The Rural Community Council started the{Best Kept Village Contest}in 1958 to encourage people to keep their villages tidy and attractive. There are five contests. There is the East Sussex large and small village,the West Sussex small and large village, the two counties championship which are held in June and July.{CONT. P.16}
